Comments.Message: Actually I disable the user from zooming That much out :) it makes the whole code much simpler. But then again I deal with country boundary limited data (RF software).
Guys, any plans to fix this issue?
plan is to implement it, because it doesn't work ;} and nobody want to do it

Hi Radioman, I'm trying to implement the continues Maps.
I managed to get the tiles if you pan map on the left or right.
But I didn't find where you set the position of the tile in the screen.
Could you explain me, how you did that?
For example, when you pan the map to the left, I return tiles 0,0 - 0,1 - 0,2 ... etc and 32,0 - 32,1 - 32,2 
but the position of the tile 32,0 on the screen is always stayed on the right.
I need to set the position on the left of the 0,0 tile.
Where did you compute this position?
Thanks for answering.
Best regards.

Up.
I tried to snoop the project to localized the property which allows to place a tile.
But snoop can't be executed on your project.
I found the PosPixel property of a tile which isn't the location of the tile on the screen, but the position of the tile in the map.
For example 0,1 => PosPixel = 0, 256.
So, can you help me? >hat is the property which is setted to place correctly the tile on the screen?
I'll still work on this issue but without your help, I can't progress on it.
Thanks for answering.
Best regards.
PosPixel is tile position in tile matrix at some level, position on screen depends on offset of viewpoint coordinates and mouse scrolling...
